Reviews.Title: “Oh what a night!”
Reviews.Author: Sassy107
Reviews.Content: After staying in a budget hotel on the M1 the previous night we were looking forward to our stay in the 'Classy, Compact, Comfortable' Pasha Hotel. As we have stayed with you before we were expecting the same standard of room as last time. My son booked this room for the two of us as a 'thank you'. When I came to check in I explained my son had booked the room on the internet for us, only to be informed they needed to see his credit card which I thought was a bit harsh as my son was not with me. In the end I had to give a copy of my credit card to the receptionist so I could book in. On arrival at the room the walls looked like they'd been rubbed down with a greasy cloth. In the bathroom, when I pressed the pedal bin the lid flew off. I went to make a cup of tea and the only socket had a fridge, tv, digi box and telephone, all in one socket so I had to disconnect one so I could boil the kettle. I laid on the bed. The only way I can explain this having visited The London Dungeons I probably would have had a better night's sleep on the Rack!! On rising in the morning my partner decided to have a shower. Suddenly I heard a piercing scream, I jumped up to be told the shower only had boiling hot water which would not regulate. I tried the cold tap but to my surprise the cold tap was also the hot tap!!! My overall opinion of your hotel was a severe disappointment having stayed with you before. On departure 'we' paid for 'our' gift from my son. We usually have breakfast in hotels but after seeing the dirty substandard rooms which you let your customers see, I did not think breakfast would be a good idea. Thank you once again for an unforgettable stay and this will be my last ever stay at the Pasha Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Hamam Experience”
Reviews.Author: BBW1960
Reviews.Content: My friend and I experienced the two hour hamam experience, which included a Turkish Bath, full body scrub and chocolate mask, all of which were excellent! We were greeted with some Turkish tea by lovely staff who were very warm and welcoming. Just before we left, we we treated to more Turkish tea which was delicious. We have both booked to return and are well looking forward to it!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely disgusting ! Do not waste your money”
Reviews.Author: Tracey C
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for one night and what a mistake ! We chose pasha as the photos on the website look very luxurious and inviting, however, what a massive disappointment ! We took a taxi to the hotel and first impressions were not good. The hotel is squeezed in amongst shops and looked very strange, even the taxi driver laughed ! The hotel lobby was full of women, screaming children and buggies, so when we were informed that our room wasn't ready for another half an hour, we had to leave the hotel as there was no where to sit and wait. Instead, we headed to the only pub that we had seen in the run down area, which was across the road, where we sat with an old chap watching a film of the tv at full volume! After checking in we were led by the receptionist up 2 flights of very narrow, steep badly lit flights of stairs which had no rails to hold, talk about a health and safety hazard.when we reached the 2nd floor we were shown in to a dark dingy room which absolutely stank of cigarette smoke, and we were told by the receptionist feel free to smoke in here! As non smokers my husband and I didn't really like the idea that we would stink like an ashtray by the end of our stay. The room was hideous ! The carpet was filthy and stained, there was an area near the bathroom that had a loose piece of carpet covering bare floor which we constantly tripped over and had to replace, the wardrobe was falling apart, the window was broken and taped up, there were. Massive gaps around the only plug socket in the room, the door to the fridge did not shut and it stunk, the drain was clogged up so the shower tray filled with filthy water and overflowed, there was a broken drain in the middle of the bathroom floor which I cut my foot on and the mattress stunk and was so cheap and thin. This was honestly the worst hotel we have ever been in, and considering we opted for a more expensive hotel as we wanted a bit of luxury, it was also a massive dissappointment. The staff wrere friendly enough but not speaking very much English made it a bit hard to communicate. I really begrudged handing over hard earned money to stay in the hovel! And at £80 a night, it is certainly not cheap. The hotel describes itself as compact, comfortable and classy! Ha more like dark, dingy, dirty, cheap, nasty and sleazy !!!!! Absolute joke, the area it's in is run down, dirty and there is absolutely no entertainment in the area (apart from the run down pub opposite). I would not pay £20 a night for this hotel, it's an insult. Save your money and find a proper hotel!!!!!!! Photos to follow

Reviews.Title: “thumbs up!!!”
Reviews.Author: carmen t
Reviews.Content: My partner and I visited the hotel for a turkish bath and a chocolate body mask, the treatments were great and the customer service from every member of staff was brilliant. I look forward to returning for future treatments.

Reviews.Title: “Amezing Time”
Reviews.Author: natalia s
Reviews.Content: I celebrated my second anniversary with my b/f last weekend Saturday, we had a Haman Scrub and a whole body Chocolate mask, it was just amazing, Ottaman was very professional, friendly and nice with us, we really enjoyed our time, we had dinner in the restaurant, the service wasn't as good, a bit slow but I think it was because the restaurant was very busy, Thank you so much, we had a nice unusual way to celebrate our anniversary

Reviews.Title: “unusual and lovely!”
Reviews.Author: gillybeans18
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my stay here. It was some time ago when I stayed so some of the things have probably changed since then. The reception area and the restaurant are lovely. I stayed in a room on the top floor and with a dodgy back it was a bit tricky negotiating the narrow steep stairs, but the very helpful lady on reception didn't hesitate to help with my luggage. The room was still being decorated so had masking tape around the paintwork but it was very clean - although you couldn't see through the window due to the fogged double glazing. Nice bathroom but the shower head was a bit dodgy. The terrace area was still under construction but I'm sure it's lovely if it's now finished. It was easy enough to get to where we needed to be in London although we went for the simple taxi option! After checking out I was waiting for my (always late) friends and the lady on reception presented me with the most delicious tea - lovely customer service. Great breakfast too. I'd definitely stay again if I was in the area.. a great little quirky hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Awful, Overpriced hotel!”
Reviews.Author: GB008
Reviews.Content: Me any gf stayed in the "deluxe" doube suite, i can say there was definately nothing deluxe about it. We spent most of the night out enjoying the nightlife, so we didn't spend much time at the hotel, thank god. There was mould above the shower head, large gaps in where the sockets should be, holes in the duvet and dirty walls. The only slightly good thing about the hotel was the staff who were relatively friendly. Apart from that the hotel looks like a cornershop from outside and the parking behind it is horrendous, litter and filth everywhere. Pay abit more and get a proper hotel!

Reviews.Title: “This is a hotel?”
Reviews.Author: KostasFalangasMGR
Reviews.Content: Clean? joke, well maintained? nice anekdote, moreover a 1-2 star hotel with bad management, a carpet inside the room very filthy, a bathroom which is a complete joke, bedsheets with hair on it, my goodness do not ever try to give your money for such a bad experience. If the Pasha hotel shall do a good renovation to the hotel it is going to be great but it really needs lots of renovation and better level of service.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic, full of atmosphere and superb customer service!”
Reviews.Author: meandhiminwalsall
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights on a business trip, 2 of them on my own, 1 when colleagues also stayed. The first night on my own I wasn't loking forward to, but I had a deep tissue massage booked for 9pm and it was simply heavenly. I ate in the restaurant 2 of the nights, and the food was absolutely gorgeous. The Â£2-00 small dishes are definitely worth a try and the Baltika 7 beer is really nice. The hotel itself has a really nice feel to it, makes a real nice change from Travelodges and the Days Inn where I've previously stayed. Pasha has atmosphere, particularly in the restaurant and my bedroom was modern with nice fixtures and fittings. Had no problem with the location, you can get several buses that stop right outside the front door (Bowyer Place). On my second night on my own I caught a bus to Waterloo Bridge and took a stroll up the South Bank. Tubes are easily accessible from Elephant and Castle which yes you need to get a bus to but it only costs Â£2.20 and is only a few stops away. The customer service is what really stood out for me at this hotel. it was absolutely brilliant. Never come across such attentive and friendly staff, and they make you feel really at home. Thanks to all at Pasha for making my stay lovely - will definitely be coming back with my fiance!

Reviews.Title: “Day Trip to London”
Reviews.Author: Foxysardar
Reviews.Content: Location : Not the Best the Location Quite Far from Nearest Tube Station and Also Surrounding places were not the Best. Ambiance : Very Good Ambiance.Actually was surprised how modern the interiors were. Room : Good room for what i Paid for and was very satisfied Misc : I was having headache and Reception provided me with tablet at 2 in the morning! Considering there is no lift and he had to come my room at 3/4 floor !

Reviews.Title: “a little jewel in south london”
Reviews.Author: lin445
Reviews.Content: my friend and i booked a hammam session and meal through Groupon and we thoroughly loved the authenticity of the experience. The staff were friendly and helpful, the hammam was so relaxing and the food was great - even for me, a vegetarian. The added bonus was the entertainment and the comfortable surroundings. I will definitely be back and have already recommended the Pasha to several friends. Thankyou

Reviews.Title: “lt was very nice time that,l have neverbeen life as a hotel custommer,because the atmosfer was like a home !”
Reviews.Author: Cristoss
Reviews.Content: l want to special thanks for all Pasha Hotel staff because of the incredible hospitality and l want to recommended all my best friends this wonderful Hotel . The Hamam was excellent and the soap massage l was like a Ottoman King

Reviews.Title: “We will never be back!”
Reviews.Author: jess1116
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel as the website was amazing, let me clarify, it was not amazing in anyway, shape or form. We would have been better staying in a hostel. The rooms were revolting, you wouldn't take your shoes off to walk on the carpet in fear of getting stuck to it! The beds were too short had 2 mattresses stacked on top of one another and the duvets were childrens length, the curtains were tied back with string and you couldn't see out of the window. The shower in the bathroom was broken so you had to hold the shower head whilst washing, pretty impossible The stairs were makeshift, the car park was a garage... The list goes on

Reviews.Title: “i will visit again”
Reviews.Author: helenxy
Reviews.Content: the food and restaurant was satisfying and all staff were very pleasant,making me feel comfortable ihad my first exsperience in the turkish bath which i thoroughly enjoyed

Reviews.Title: “Very impressed!”
Reviews.Author: SunflowerPortsmouth
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a night in Pasha Hotel with my sister for her 18th birthday. We had a little confusion getting there and we ended up walking from Kennington station (about 20 mins) and the area is a little rough (maybe I'm just a softie!!) but found the hotel very easily. I'm not sure why some reviews have said the front of the hotel looks like a shop or a restaurant. It was clearly labeled and looked nothing but professional from the outside. The receptionist was very helpful, asking where we had come from and what our plans were so she could guide us on how to best get to where we wanted to go. Was seeing a gig in Brixton and the buses (34 or 45) take you practically outside the venue in under 20 mins. The room outside was spotless, very smart. The bathroom was lovely with a walk in shower. We even had two cans of coke and some crisps waiting for us free of charge in our room! The air con was lovely as well as it was a hot night! The only improvements I could suggest is making it clearer on the website that there is no elevator. The stairs are narrow and not well lit so we had a few stumbles (especially after a few glasses of wine!) and I wouldn't want to take elderly relatives there with no lift. Apart from that it was lovely! Thanks a lot for a lovely night!

Reviews.Title: “Great facilities let down by very rude staff”
Reviews.Author: agreendream
Reviews.Content: Over a two week period I called 6 times before I was finally given a booking. When we arrived the booking had been changed by an hour! from 8pm to 9.15pm. We used the Hammam sauna which was wonderful! BUT the facility's for storing your wallet/phone valuables - A plastic bag that a staff member then takes away and puts behind reception. Not cleaver or safe. We then went for three course Asian meal that was part of the deal I had been bought as a gift. The restaurant setting like the sauna is great fun. How ever the staff where so rude and simply dismissed us. Eventually our order was taken, again in a rude manor. Over all the place should be a great treat in London but from reception to paying the bill the staff where all so rude and unfriendly I would not advise some one choose this as "a nice place to go".

Reviews.Title: “Good Value for money...”
Reviews.Author: walkandspa
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel as convenient base for an anniversary weekend to London to see a gig at Brixton Academy. The hotel staff were friendly and helpful. The bus stopped almost outside the hotel meaning we could get to and from the gig easily and without walking far (even at 3am when the gig finished) which was perfect since tubes dont run then. The hotel isnt 5* but it was clean and comfy and the staff even surprised us with wine and balloons in the room! Breakfast was brilliantly good value - cant think where else in London you could get a cooked breakfast, toast, coffee and juice for Â£5.00!! Thank you and we shall be staying again if we are ever at Brixton Academy.

Reviews.Title: “Website is deceiving”
Reviews.Author: samjmorton
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Pasha as it was close to a party we were going to. The hotel is really in need of a refurb, the carpets didn't smell too great. However the staff were really helpful and friendly. Not a place I would recommend to stay though unless you need to be in that area specifically.

Reviews.Title: “A little oasis of calm along the red carpet... Hamman and restaurant.”
Reviews.Author: londonlala
Reviews.Content: Having read previous reviews I was a little hesitant as to what to expect when my friend and I turned up for the Groupon Hamman experience. I needn't of worried we were taken care of from the moment we stepped inside the hotel. We had the Turkish bath area to ourselves and were able to lock the door and the outside world out where we relaxed for an hour. This was followed bya delicious three course meal which included a glass of wine. Again a very relaxing experience and we were allowed to take our time to enjoy it. My friend and I cannot understand the negative comments so much so that I felt compelled to write this -my first ever- review. The staff were attentive and polite;nothing was too much. Yes, it would appear they have taken on board some of the negative comments such as offering us a locker to put our valubles in although we didn't require the facility and there are two choices of set menu. I applaud the management for this. Would we come back? Yes without a doubt. All in all a fab experience.

Reviews.Title: “Only used faciities for hamman”
Reviews.Author: divabling
Reviews.Content: Got a groupon deal for Hamman and 3 course meal for Â£15.00. Was unfortunately a bad experience. The changing room was cramped and the lockers had NO LOCKS on them and there area was lit by candles which looked pretty but because the area was so small I had set FIRE to my woolie scarf. Was not happy! Could not relax in the hamman as all my stuff was in the unsecured locker and shared the hamman with another couple, they were nice but they could have taken my valuables, they didn't but you have to be careful. The hamman itself was pleasant until I say this man from the hotel peeping at us in the gap at the top of the door, was very unsettling. The meal was terrible, No choice of starter and was horrible, was only given a choice of 3 main meals went for rice and lamb. It was so greasy, they fried the rice in oil and meat was fatty. Desert was two pieces of small Turkish biscuit/cake. The only thing wasn nice was the wine.

Reviews.Title: “Don't waste your time and money!”
Reviews.Author: TaraX_London
Reviews.Content: Had an aweful experience there today. 3 friends and I had booked to go to the hammam through groupon but were asked for more money when we arrived even though we had already paid months in advance. Ended up not even using the hammam after travelling an hour and a half to get there and spending any hour arguing with the very rude manager and staff. It was a complete waste of time and I would never go back to this place.

Reviews.Title: “VERY disappointed - TV did not work, no temp controls in room”
Reviews.Author: Cana1bank
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed with a group of 12 friends for a night out in Brixton. The TV did not work and the staff were very unhelpful - After unsuccessfully trying to get the TV to work they left the room to fetch a colleague but nobody returned! I was suprised that that did not offer ANY refund even though the rooms are clearly advertised with a television

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing certainly not worth the money they charge”
Reviews.Author: ilonaplumb
Reviews.Content: Very disappointed, the room was basic to say the least and was not clean, the only saving grace was the bathroom which was modern but again unclean. The food was awful, but the restaurant did have a lovely feel about it - so I would recommend going in there for a drink. The Hammam was not your typical Turkish hammam - you had to pay for the body scrub and massage seperately which was expensive and again not worth the money. All in all I am glad we only stayed one night and we wont be visiting again.

Reviews.Title: “Boutique hotel, good food.”
Reviews.Author: cleo3003
Reviews.Content: It is a cute boutique hotel with a great restaurant. The hotel seems to cater mainly for Russians. The room appeared to be clean but the carpet could have done with a good vacuum, the window was dirty and there was a draft. The bathroom was spacious and appeared to be clean but the toilet seat was dirty and the toilet smelt of urine. The shower had a bath mixer tap in it with an attachment that had low pressure and hot & cold were the wrong way around. Although there were complementary toiletries provided. The staff were very polite and accommodating but they seemed to be confused about some aspects of the service they offered. We were misinformed of the times that breakfast was served we were told 8-10am but it ran until 11am and we requested a newspaper to be delivered to our room, this did not happen and when I spoke to the receptionist he apologised and offered to go out and get one. I also feel that the Â£5 parking charge is slightly unnecessary.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, lovely deco, friendly staff, good Brkfast, great location, perfect.”
Reviews.Author: ly_thach
Reviews.Content: The greatest thing about this Hotel is its location and its rates. Its neighbourhood is not the most beautiful in London, but with over 10 different bus routes going past it, and its within walking distance of Elephant & Castle and Waterloo stations. The reception also has the best map of London including a map of the bus routes, for free ! There is a Chinese 'All-U-can-Eat' nearby. The hotel is a 10-15min bus trip to most attractions, eg. London Eye, British Museum, Westminster Abbey, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic - real gem!”
Reviews.Author: mayald
Reviews.Content: Went here for the hammam spa treatment and was incredibly impressed. Ok so is a little bit of a trek from the tube (only 15 min.s or so) and on a less than glamourous high street. However when you get in, it's fantastic. Staff were without exception really sweet and friendly and hotel is really clean and stylish. The treatment itself was fantastic, leisurely, really good therapist and made my skin feel fantastic. Ate in the restaurnat afterwards which is lovely - almost like another world and not London at all and food was of a very good standard. highly recommend, will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing value - superb staff!”
Reviews.Author: 93HappyWanderer
Reviews.Content: I was travelling on expenses for a small charity, so booked the cheapest room I could find near where I was to be (The Oval). I was very nervous of somewhere offering a room at Â£50 per night and expected the worst. When I arrived, the staff seemed genuinely pleased to greet me and show me to my room - much more welcoming that many five star hotels I have stayed in. A bit quirky, limited space, but everything you need (including air conditioning for warmer times). The TV worked with a good choice of channels - a big bonus when you are travelling alone. The restaurant - half Turkish in layout, half western European - was excellent value for money. Good range of near eastern dishes. On the Friday night it included live music. A really great experience in both hotel and restaurant. Do they just employ really helpful staff, or is their training something to be envied? This is only the second hotel where I have felt all the staff are pleased (rather than just willing) to put themselves out for the benefit of the guests, Well done to the whole team!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place inside, shame about the water system and noisy trains”
Reviews.Author: leek1972
Reviews.Content: I stayed here as everywhere else nearby was fully booked. I saw a bad review on TA but there were more positive reviews so thought i'd give it a whirl. I had been warned by friends that this area was quite dodgy, to back this up a black cab that we flagged down from nearby Waterloo refused to brings us back to the hotel and just drove off to leave us freezing in minus 2 about midnight - anyway getting back to review of Pasha, the room was modern and clean, staff friendly and professional but we woke on Sunday morning to discover there was no water supply to our room. I reported this to reception and was told it was a known problem, (turns out the whole 3rd floor was affected by a water pressure issue) "we're sorry" they said. I asked how we were supposed to shower\brush our teeth? The offer was to travel down to the ground floor and use another facility, we declined and left. When i went ot settle up i expressed my concerns and said i wasn't happy to pay, the counter offer was "other hotels would give you 20% off" as the room itself had met all conditions. We agreed to disagree in the end and Pasha made a token gesture by refunding under half the cost. Overall impression Dodgy area Inside hotel is very nice, staff are good. Water pressure thing needs sorting and the trains are noisy Make your own minds up, i was unimpressed

Reviews.Title: “Grim and Sleazy Hotel in a Grim and Sleazy Location”
Reviews.Author: JXBR
Reviews.Content: I left it to the last minute to book a hotel for a business trip and this was the only hotel available. At least I learned a lesson about leaving matters to the last minute. The hotel is an " eclectic" mix of several "styles" but many bordello sleaze.

Reviews.Title: “Home from Home”
Reviews.Author: Missjosefina
Reviews.Content: I got lucky and found this gem back in February 2010. Since then, every time I stay in South London, I always ask our Travel Department to book me in to this delightful hotel. As a solo female traveller, I have to say I feel 'looked after' by the wonderful team. The food's great (room service even better!), the facilities are always clean and fresh, the bed is more than adequate and the deluxe shower is very welcome after a hard day at the grindstone. With the exception of the location, I am struggling to find anything negative about Pasha Hotel. The Bourbonator

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff but poor bedroom”
Reviews.Author: Walkingfoodie
Reviews.Content: Pasha's a bit of a trip beyond Elephant & Castle but was one direct bus ride away from Euston and Westminster so was pretty easy to get to and from. Staff are really lovely, friendly and helpful but are let down by some of the rooms. I went to London with my sister and my 23 year old nephew for a long weekend sight-seeing, visiting museums, meeting up with friends etc. My nephew's single basic room although small was en-suite, in a quiet part of the hotel and he was perfectly happy with it. Unfortunately, the twin room me and my sister shared overlooked the very busy, noisy road which never seemed to be short of traffic. It was also up some steep, very windy stairs that my sister struggled with - there's no lift. Although the room was clean (in the sense it'd been hoovered, polished, clean bedding etc) the carpets were very stained and frayed and the bathroom smelt very bad indeed! The windows were also very dirty. It was a good size room with good facilities apart from that. To be honest, we hardly got any sleep due to traffic noise and would have asked to move if we were staying any longer - we did debate moving but didn't want to waste any time of our visit. The breakfast was fine (apart from the use of frankfurter sausages in the English breakfast!) with plenty of choice - coffee/tea, juice, eggs, fruit, yoghurt, honey, toast etc.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem”
Reviews.Author: mouchie
Reviews.Content: Quite deceiving from the outside as the area and surrounding buildings are rather run down but inside of the Pasha Hotel is absolutely stunning. The owners have obviously spent a lot of money renovating it. The bedrooms were spotless, bed very comfy and the bathrooms rather luxurious. I cannot stress enough how friendly the staff were. They bent over backwards to make my stay enjoyable. Its the friendlines of the staff which really made my stay as good customer service in London is usually very lacking. The hotel is only 15-20 mins by bus to central london. I have stayed in hotels closer to the city but being a very light leeper have always found the noise of the city to be an isue for me. I would highly recommend this hotel and would definitely stay there again

Reviews.Title: “very clean room and helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: lindanov24
Reviews.Content: Staff very helpful, they let me have my room an hour early at no extra charge as we has travelled from warrington and you can't ask more than that. Breakfast was great. The air con was lovely. The overall stay was wonderful and my 13 year old daughter loved the hotel also. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “friendly, clean, and very helpful”
Reviews.Author: chrissucco
Reviews.Content: the staff at the pasha hotel were extremely friendly and very helpful. the room was excellant, clean with everything you need for a short stay. the bed was comftable and i slept very well. the location is about a five minute bus ride from the elephant and castle tube station, the bus stop being just outside the hotel. From the elephant it is about a ten minute tube ride into central london. The hotel has a lovely restaurant serving very well priced tasty food, the breakfast was a bit small but for a fiver you cant really complain. overall an excellant place to stay when visiting london.

Reviews.Title: “We didn't even get to the room”
Reviews.Author: Lucyjosephine
Reviews.Content: Never ever ever ever ever ever ever EVER consider staying here. The area it is in is dodgy to say the least. The parking is round the back, there are about 5 reallllly narrow spaces, which out car would not fit in, amongst the vans from the M.O.T test center next door. We were weary about even going into the hotel. The back entrance was full of cut off bits of wood and old carpet. You have to walk through the whole of the hotel from the car park to get to the reception. The restaurant is cheap and tacky, with a bridge in the middle, the staff just looked at us gone out! Our baggage was eyed up by a sun bed customer. We went and asked about the parking, and he insisted that there were spaces, but there weren't. We went for a drive around and ended up parking in iceland car park, which felt very dodgy, everybody looking at us. The hotel looks like a brothel, or a cheap tacky chinese restaurant! It is in between a shop and a barber, literally all the shops on the street were barbers and nail technicians. We went to check in, even though my mum reallllly did not want to stay there, but we decided to go and look at the room before making our decision on whether to stay, yes it really was that bad! So we went to check in, and they had got our dates wrong, by a month! Normally this would have been a huge problem but in this case, it was a god send, meaning we could cancel the booking and get our money back. I was soooo glad to get out of this place!

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Value”
Reviews.Author: pughies
Reviews.Content: We booked a week in the Pasha because our son was having an operation in near by King's College Hospital. We booked a double economy room as our intention was to use it infrequently. The hotel was ideally situated for the hospital - 20 minute walk or 10 minute ride on the number 45 Denmark Hill bus. The staff were extremely friendly and couldn't do enough for us. The restaurant served excellent food. The room was compact but at Â£65 per room per night was excellent value. We would definately use again.

Reviews.Title: “Eccentric, Friendly, Economy hotel”
Reviews.Author: fi_12000
Reviews.Content: It is hard to have the heart to say anything negative about this hotel as the staff are so genuinely friendly and helpful, and are prepared to go out of their way to ensure your comfort. They kept my bag a whole day after I checked out at no extra cost for which I am extremely grateful I think the staff at the hotel are mainly from the former Soviet Central Asian Republics and is a hub for the community which gives it an exotic vibe. The decor is Central Asian with a slight Soviet flavour. More could be done with decor in the rooms, in particular, to make them a bit more boutique-like and less utilitarian. That said the bed was fine and the bathroom functioned well. I would come again for the atmosphere and friendly staff if nothing else.

Reviews.Title: “A Unique London Experince”
Reviews.Author: srich710
Reviews.Content: We were accompaning our daughter for the fall term at Kings College, and were originally booked at a hotel closer to the center of London. We wanted to be closer to her dorm. This hotel was recommended by one of the staff at the College. The first impression was not favorable, and I asked to see the room before commiting to a stay. Our room was a third floor, very steep, walkup, no lifts. But the room was quite modern and clean, so we decided to stay for the remaining five nights. The staff was very accomodating, although not very conversant in English. The ride to London attractions is via a bus, and then the underground if needed. Not a problem. There are few restuarants in the immediate area. We had a traditional English breakfast a couple of the mornings, and one dinner in the hotel. The food was not great, but acceptable. This would be a good place to stay for anyone visiting Kings College.

Reviews.Title: “Bad location, over priced, terrible beds!! (and things went missing....)”
Reviews.Author: LondonTraveller1234
Reviews.Content: The service was ok apart from a fairly lapse reception girl. And the food was nice but plain and overpriced. It has treatment rooms in the hotel for various things but were advised by other guests not to bother as the girl 'didn't have a clue what she was doing'. Not really the place to relax and be pampered anyway... The room was nowhere near as good as the pictures made out, especially as we paid extra for a 'deluxe double' and the bed wasn't even a full sized double?! No wonder they wouldn't let us take a peek as we checked in early and had to leave our bags in reception. The shower had a serious tempature problem and wasn't powerful at all. Really noisy pub which kept us awake until late too..Our friends came back and wanted to use our room to get changed in and they charged us almost Â£20 per person to come into our pokey room for more than five minutes. RIP OFF! We also had items go missing from our room and were told by the Management that, 'we had signed a disclaimer on check in'? I understand passports etc needing to be put in a safe but not expensive toiletries etc?! Its more dodgy inside the hotel than it is in mugging capital camberwell!! Best advice would be find somewhere else, its a taxi ride from anywhere, no local tube, your property is signed away on checking in. BAD BAD BAD!

Reviews.Title: “Would recommend”
Reviews.Author: Umpycook
Reviews.Content: This is a lovley hotel in camberwell and good for money, the staff are very helpfull and i had a good nights sleep. the only thing i would say is that the room stank of smoke and the room could of done with a touch up here and there, all in all a very nice place and i would return

Reviews.Title: “Great value, very friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: JohnBairdAberdeen
Reviews.Content: I paid Â£53 per night in what is a very clean hotel with friendly staff. The decor may seem a little odd to British travellers, being Kazak/Kyrg in style, but I thought that added something. It's liek a cut-price boutique hotel and for the money I thought it was spot on. I didn't try the restaurant but it looks good and had belly dancers on! My only (very small) grip is that the small window in my room didn't have curtains, so I had to lay some cushions along the sill to keep out light. Otherwise great.

Reviews.Title: “Our stay”
Reviews.Author: clarencejudy
Reviews.Content: We were there for 4 nights. Our stay was good, but the food was not our cup of tee. The breakfast was verry nice but with dinner it's a outher story.(tastes differ simply.) If there was a problem, the staff wil do annything to make it good. they were verry nice to the gast. Oure room om the 3e floor was ok. a lote of stairs and no elevaor. Bathroom need more finishing. There is a waredrope but you can not use him. It was to small and there were too much stuff in it, that not belong in a waredrope. overall it was a experience.

Reviews.Title: “contextualise expectations”
Reviews.Author: Kaitua
Reviews.Content: Last week, I spent two nights at the Pasha hotel. The booking was made before we read the reviews. Given the negative publicity the hotel has received, we would not have stayed there if it wasn't for the need to be close to a conference venue. All that was mentioned is true and no doubt will influence others to look elsewhere for a hotel in the area. However, there are positives and with time I have little doubt the owner will make improvements to Pasha. The place is next to a railway line, but the owner tries as much as possible to offer the quieter rooms first. Rates are reasonable, considering the hotel is in London. We paid Â£70 for two. Breakfast at an extra charge of Â£5 never materialized, but we preferred to look for a cafe or coffee shop and make our own choices. The room was spotless, the TV worked, and the staff were very friendly. The hotel was on an excellent bus route to the South Bank and the city centre. My hope is that with support, the owner will focus on some of the details: better internal insulation and fresher passageways that absorb some of the scents from the sauna room. The bathroom facilities could do with improvements, the electrical wiring in the bedroom was rather makeshift and the beds need reading lamps. He has tried to create a small Turkish haven with some of the amenities - the sauna, the beautician's salon and the restaurant at the back of the hotel. This was a very brave decision, considering the location isn't upmarket London. My only advice to him is to focus now so that expectations are met and Pasha becomes a signature establishment in the area.

Reviews.Title: “If you need a crash pad in South London this will do the job.”
Reviews.Author: kuffdam73
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Pasha on a Friday night as we were going to a concert at the Brixton Academy and wanted to stay the night somewhere relatively near by rather than try and get the last train home from Waterloo. Hotel Pasha was around 10/15 mins bus ride from Brixton and the price for a superior double room (Â£90 + Â£10 for 2 breakfasts & Â£5 to park in the car park) was within our budget so it seemed the perfect choice. Having read a few of the reviews on this site I was slightly uncertain as to what we had let ourselves in for in terms of the actual hotel but if you know South London and Camberwell in particular you'll know that you're not getting the picture postcard side of London with regard to the area and the hotels location. The car park at the rear of the hotel doesn't really give you a great first impression (think Hill Street Blues) but once you're inside the hotel you soon forget about that. As stated in other reviews the hotel does indeed back onto railway lines and you actually pass under the railway arches (if you enter from the car park) in order to get to the front desk via the restuarant & function room. The front desk staff were very welcoming and friendly and we were shown to our room after filling out the obligatory form and provding proof of ID. Our room (312) did back directly onto the railway line and it was certainly very obvious when a train went past that it wasn't going to be something you could ignore if you were in the room for any length of time. We decided to bite the bullet and stay put based on the fact that we were going straight back out again and wouldn't be returning until after 11pm. To be fair I don't think any trains went past at all on Saturday morning so my concern about getting woken up by the first early morning train was unfounded. It may be a different case on a week day though.... I would say that perhaps only 6 of the hotels rooms are actually directly overlooking the railway lines and that if you weren't in one of those 6 rooms you probably would never know that they were there. I guess the staff would move you to another room (if available) without hesitation if you requested not be near the railway lines, it's probably worth checking with them when you book if you know it's going to cause you a problem. The room itself was totally acceptable, decent comfy bed with clean white linen and towels in the bathroom. It looks like the rooms were refurbed in the last couple of years in the contemporary IKEA showroom style, which was fine by us. Breakfast was a standard English affair, sausage, bacon, egg, tomato with tea or coffee. The coffee was very good but I'd expect that from a Turkish owned and run hotel. As I said earlier the staff were really helpful and friendly and they let us leave the car in the car park all day Saturday whilst we went into central London to do some shopping and sightseeing. The hotel is served very well by bus routes with stops just outside that will run you into central London in 20/25 mins. Despite the train lines that run behind the hotel there is no underground station within walking distance so you would really need to either use the buses or take taxi rides to get out and about. As I say in the title of this review "If you need a crash pad in South London this will do the job".
